thread.title: Injured Finn Out Of Tour, Jordan Brought In
thread.title_full: Injured Finn Out Of Tour, Jordan Brought In

title: Injured Finn Out Of Tour, Jordan Brought In
text:
Injured Finn Out Of Tour, Jordan Brought In 09:16, UK, Wednesday 14 October 2015 Share by email Steven Finn has been ruled out of the remainder of England's tour of the UAE and will be replaced by Chris Jordan. 
Fast bowler Finn has a bone stress injury to his left foot which requires a period of rest, and the Middlesex star is returning to the UK for further assessment. 
Sussex pace bowler Jordan has been called up to both the Test and ODI squads to face Pakistan and will arrive during the ongoing first Test. 
Finn had been in contention to play in the first Test with Pakistan after bowling superbly in the final warm-up match, taking 4-16 in 15 overs. 
The injury is a cruel blow for England and the player. Eighteen months ago Finn was deemed "unselectable" by England after he suffered a crisis of confidence - and technique - during the 2013/14 Ashes tour. 
But he made a triumphant return in this summer's Ashes, taking 6-79 at Edgbaston. 
Jordan, who missed much of the county season with a side injury, played the last of his eight Tests against the West Indies in Barbados in April. Promoted Stories
